text: Two ships of the British Royal Navy have been named HMS Poictiers. Poictiers is an alternative spelling for Poitiers, and in this instance commemorates the English victory there. * The first was a 74-gun third rate launched in 1809. She participated in an action where she rescued by capturing in 1812. Poictiers was broken up in 1857. * The second Poictiers was a 2,380-ton launched in April 1946, but broken up soon after. Category:Royal Navy ship names
title: HMS Poictiers
